snippet: The Obama administration says it wants to give states more latitude in running welfare-to-work programs, but Republicans say it is a power grab.
abstract: Move by the Obama administration to give states more latitude in running federal welfare-to-work programs sets off a firestorm among Republicans, who say it is a power grab that undercuts the work requirements set forth in the 1996 overhaul of welfare policy.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration says it wants to give states more latitude in running welfare-to-work programs, but Republicans say it is a power grab.

headline.main: Shift in Welfare Policy Draws G.O.P. Protests
headline.print_headline: Shift in Welfare Policy Draws G.O.P. Protests
